means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 普雷蒂绰号，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“漂亮的”(fine,pleasing,excellent)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"美丽的，漂亮的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: beautiful, fair, handsome, lovely, pretty, fine
means: beautiful ： 普通用词，含义广泛，语气最强，指优美和谐，是一种几乎接近完美的美。指人时通常形容女人或小孩，很少用于描写男子。
fair ： 正式用词，多用于文学中，形容女子和儿童，侧重外表的美。
handsome ： 多用于描写男性的英俊潇洒。有时也形容女人，指其五官端正，体态秀丽。
lovely ： 普通用词，描写人时，主要指女人和小孩的相貌，语气不如beautiful强。
pretty ： 普通用词，语气比beautiful弱，多用于描写妇女、儿童以及小巧玲珑，精美可爱之物。
fine ： 指在容貌、身材或风度等方面令人感到可爱。用于事物时，强调形式或内容的优美。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些程度副词都有"相当，颇"之意。
means: fairly ： 语意最弱，多用于褒义，表示适度地、尚可的意思。不可与too或比较级连用。
pretty ： 用法与rather相似。常用于非正式文体。
quite含义比fairly稍强，与不定冠词连用时，一般放在不定冠词之前。
rather语气比quite强，褒意贬意无可使用。可与too和比较级连用。

list.explanation: 毫无突出特点的人或物，平庸之辈

example.en: He had a time convincing them he was a genuine expert, not just another pretty face.
example.zh: 他曾一度使他们相信，他是一位真正的专家，而不是平庸之辈。

entry.def: If you describe someone, especially a girl, as pretty, you mean that they look nice and are attractive in a delicate way.
entry.tran: （尤指女孩）漂亮的，好看的，标致的

example.ex: She's a very charming and very pretty girl.
example.tran: 她是一个非常迷人的漂亮女孩。

entry.def: A place or a thing that is pretty is attractive and pleasant, in a charming but not particularly unusual way.
entry.tran: （地方或事物）漂亮的，美丽的（但无特殊之处）

example.ex: Whitstable is still a very pretty little town.
example.tran: 惠特斯特布尔仍然是一个非常漂亮的小镇。

example.ex: ...comfortable sofas covered in a pretty floral print.
example.tran: 罩着漂亮的印花布的舒适沙发

entry.def: You can use pretty before an adjective or adverb to mean 'quite' or 'rather'.

example.ex: I had a pretty good idea what she was going to do...
Pretty soon after my arrival I found lodgings.
example.tran: 我到达之后，很快就找到了住处。

example.ex: His new government looks pretty much like the old one...
example.tran: 他的新政府看起来和旧政府没什么两样。

example.ex: I travel pretty well every week.
example.tran: 我几乎每周都出去旅行。

entry.def: If you say that someone is sitting pretty, you mean that they are in a good, safe, or comfortable position.
entry.tran: 处于有利的位置；处境优越

example.ex: When the war started, they thought they were sitting pretty, because they had all that extra grain.
example.tran: 战争开始的时候，他们认为自己境况不错，因为他们粮食准备充足。

means.word_mean: 1. pleasing by delicacy or grace; not imposing;
1. used as an intensifier (`jolly' is used informally in Britain);

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English prettig; related to Middle Dutch pertich 'brisk, clever', obsolete Dutch prettig 'humorous, sporty', from a West Germanic base meaning 'trick'. The sense development 'deceitful, cunning, clever, skilful, admirable, pleasing, nice' has parallels in adjectives such as canny, fine, nice, etc

means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 普雷蒂绰号，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“漂亮的”(fine,pleasing,excellent)

sentences.en: Marilyn is pretty girl but the new barmaid at our local pub leaves her standing.

sentences.en: I thought it was pretty obvious.

sentences.cn: 公司近来情况相当不错.
sentences.en: The firm is stacking up pretty well these days.

sentences.cn: 她对那结果似乎相当满意.
sentences.en: She seemed pretty satisfied with the result.

sentences.cn: 我小时候跑得相当快.
sentences.en: I could run pretty fast when I was boy.

sentences.cn: 哦, 但是我相当确信你将会想要睡得很多.
sentences.en: Oh, but I am pretty sure that you will be wanting to sleep a lot.

sentences.cn: 我家相当穷.
sentences.en: My family is pretty poor.

sentences.cn: 她误以为自己是班上最漂亮的人.
sentences.en: She has the illusion that she is the prettiest in her class.

sentences.cn: 我的朋友喜欢任何漂亮的人或事物.
sentences.en: My friend loves anybody and anything that is pretty.

sentences.cn: 我的哥们喜爱任何漂亮的人或事物.
sentences.en: My friend loves anybody and anything those is pretty.
